ScaleGenerator

Module Summary

Generates all scales and their notes with interval variations.

Imports

os: Used to obtain path to .json file.

copy: Used to deepcopy objects.

json: Used to dump all the scales to .json format.

Global variables

generators.scalegenerator.BASE_SCALES: dict

Contains the natural major, minor, harmonic and melodic minor scales.

generators.scalegenerator.GREEK_MODES: dict

Contains the greek modes and their intervals.

generators.scalegenerator.DIATONIC_SCALES: dict

Contains all diatonic (7-note) scales.

generators.scalegenerator.PENTATONICS: dict

Contains both major and minor pentatonic scales.

generators.scalegenerator.ROOTS: list

Contains all notes to be used as scale roots.

Functions

make_chromatic_scale(): Generates a chromatic scale.

get_interval_index(): Gets an interval’s index from a list.

generate_all_scales(): Generates all scales using all roots.

dump_scales(): Dumps scales in .json format.

Classes

Scale: Defines scales.

ScaleGenerator: Generates scales.

Functions

generators.scalegenerator.make_chromatic_scale(root: str) → list

Make a chromatic scale with a given root.

Uses two variables containing possible keys and makes a new list of notes using naturals and only flats or sharps present in ROOTS, then sets the root of the scale as the one given.

Parameters:

root (str) – Root of the scale to be made.

Returns:

The generated chromatic scale.

Return type:

list

generators.scalegenerator.get_interval_index(interv: str) → int

Get the index of an interval from a list with all intervals.

generators.scalegenerator.generate_all_scales() → list[generators.scalegenerator.Scale]

Generate all possible scales using constants and classes.

Instantiates a generic scale generator and an empty scale list, then iterates through ROOTS, setting the generator’s root to be the current iteration value. Then, uses generate() on module scale constants DIATONIC_SCALES and PENTATONICS, then generate_variations() to add all variations. After, extends the scale list with the scales generated so far and returns it at the end.

Returns:

All scales with variations included.

Return type:

list[Scale]

generators.scalegenerator.dump_scales(all_scales: list[generators.scalegenerator.Scale], dump_path='../data')

Dump scales generated to a .json file.

Declares a dictionary to put all scales in, then gets the notes of all scales and format said scales for putting in the variable. Afterwards, get the path of the dump using the os module and finally dumps the variable to a .json file.

Parameters:

  • all_scales (list[Scale]) – List containing all scales generated.

  • dump_path (str) – Directory to dump scales in.

Variables:

scale_dump (dict) – Variable to contain all formatted scales.

Scale.get_root() → str

Get the root of the scale object.

Checks for the presence of an accident and return the portion of the scale’s name corresponding to the root.

Returns:

The root of the scale.

Return type:

str

Scale.get_scale_notes()

Get the notes of the scale object.

First, gets the root of the scale and makes a chromatic scale based on it, then uses get_interval_index() to get each interval’s index from a list of all them and uses said index on the chromatic scale to get the respective note.

ScaleGenerator Methods

ScaleGenerator.generate(name_intervals: dict)

Make scales based on a dictionary with names and intervals.

Iterates through the dictionary, grabbing the keys to compose the name of the scale and the values to compose the intervals. Finally, append to scales_generated the composed scale.

Parameters:

name_intervals (dict) – The dictionary containing scale data.

ScaleGenerator.add_variation(variation_dict: dict)

Add variations to existing scales.

Iterates through a copy of the existing scales, then through the dictionary of variations, checking if each variation in its natural form is in the scale’s intervals. If true, makes a deepcopy of the scale object, substitutes the old interval by the variation and add the variation’s name to the scale’s name. Finally, appends the new scale to scales_generated.

Parameters:

variation_dict (dict) – Dictionary containing variations.

ScaleGenerator.generate_variations()

Use class dictionaries to generate all scale variations.
